sections.name: BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT

bill.title: Reduces the required minimum age for obtaining a junior archery license
bill.summary: Reduces the required minimum age for obtaining a junior archery license from fourteen years to twelve years of age.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to reducing the required minimum age for obtaining a junior archery license

bill.title: Authorizes DEC to designate additional fishing events as rehabilitation for armed forces veterans or active members
bill.summary: Authorizes DEC to designate additional fishing events as rehabilitation for armed forces veterans or active members.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to fishing events as rehabilitation for members of the United States armed forces

bill.title: Provides for the return of lost hunting dogs
bill.summary: Provides that any dog that has been released from their confinement for hunting purposes shall be deemed to be under the reasonable control of its owner while engaged in hunting or returning from hunting.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to lost hunting dogs

bill.title: Provides that persons participating in a fishing class or clinic sponsored by a school or university are exempt from fishing license requirements
bill.summary: Provides that persons participating in a fishing class or clinic sponsored by a school or university are exempt from fishing license requirements.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to providing that persons participating in a non-commercial fishing class or clinic sponsored by a school or university are exempt from fishing license requirements

bill.title: Allows hunters in the county of Chautauqua to hunt bear and deer by the use of a rifle
bill.summary: Allows hunters to use a rifle during open season for deer and bear in the county of Chautauqua south of route 20.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to allowing the use of rifles for deer hunting in the county of Chautauqua;

bill.title: Authorizes the catching and possession of up to 5 times the daily limit of fish during any 7 day period of time
bill.summary: Authorizes the catching and possession of up to 5 times the daily limit of fish during any 7 day period of time; authorizes the catching and possession on a single vessel of the maximum daily limit for each species of fish a person aboard the vessel is authorized to take.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to authorizing the catching and possession of five times the daily limit for any species of fish during any seven consecutive day period and authorizing the catching and possession on a single vessel of the daily limits of any species of fish for which a person aboard such vessel holds a license for the taking thereof; and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon the expiration thereof

bill.title: Allows hunters to use a rifle during open season for deer in the county of Cortland
bill.summary: Allows hunters to use a rifle during open season for deer in the county of Cortland.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to allowing the use of rifles for hunting in Cortland county

bill.title: Allows local tax collectors to send tax statements by electronic mail to an address provided by a homeowner and to opt out of receiving paper statements
bill.summary: Allows local tax collectors to send tax statements by electronic mail to an address provided by a homeowner and to opt out of receiving paper statements of taxes.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to allowing statements of taxes via electronic mail

bill.title: Authorizes local governments to deliver proposed local laws to members of their legislative bodies by means of e-mail
bill.summary: Authorizes local governments to deliver proposed local laws to members of their legislative bodies by means of e-mail.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the municipal home rule law, in relation to authorizing the electronic transmission of proposed local laws to members of a local legislative body

bill.title: Defines the crime of surreptitious surveillance; rebuttable presumption that such surveillance under certain conditions is for no legitimate purpose
bill.summary: Defines the crime of surreptitious surveillance, a class B misdemeanor, when a person, for purposes of his or her own amusement, or for the purpose of degrading another person, or for his or her own sexual arousal, or for no legitimate purpose, surreptitiously observes by means of the unaided eye or an imaging device, intimate parts of an other person without that person's consent and at a place and time when such other person has a reasonable expectation of privacy; includes a rebuttable presumption that such surveillance under certain conditions is for no legitimate purpose; makes such offense a class B misdemeanor.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to the crime of surreptitious surveillance, a class B misdemeanor

bill.title: Relates to sanctions for driving while ability impaired while holding a conditional license
bill.summary: Relates to sanctions for driving while ability impaired while holding a conditional license.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to sanctions for driving while ability impaired while holding a conditional license

bill.title: Establishes a person is guilty of grand larceny in the fourth degree when he or she steals property and is in possession of an anti-security item
bill.summary: Establishes a person is guilty of grand larceny in the fourth degree when he or she steals property and is in possession of an anti-security item; makes criminal possession of an anti-security item a class A misdemeanor.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to the possession of anti-security items

bill.title: Defines the terms "impaired" and "intoxication" for the purposes of the vehicle and traffic law
bill.summary: Defines the terms "impaired" and "intoxication" for the purposes of the vehicle and traffic law.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to the definitions of the terms "impaired" and "intoxication" for the purposes of such law

bill.title: Expands geographical jurisdiction for crimes attendant to identity theft or unlawful possession of personal information
bill.summary: Expands geographical jurisdiction for crimes attendant to identity theft or the unlawful possession of personal information.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law, in relation to expanding the geographical jurisdiction for crimes attendant to identify theft or unlawful possession of personal identification information

bill.title: Increases the penalty for crime of criminally negligent homicide
bill.summary: Increases the penalty for the crime of criminally negligent homicide by changing such offense to a class D felony from a class E felony.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to criminally negligent homicide

bill.title: Allows a court to preclude disclosure of jurors' names and addresses; repealer
bill.summary: Allows a court to issue an order precluding the disclosure of jurors' names and addresses upon a showing by the people that such an order is necessary to prevent bribery, jury tampering or physical injury to, or harassment of, the jurors or prospective jurors.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law, in relation to anonymous juries and to repeal subdivision 1-a of section 270.15 of such law relating thereto

bill.title: Prohibits the use of radar and laser blocking devices in all motor vehicles
bill.summary: Prohibits the use of radar and laser blocking devices in all motor vehicles.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to radar and laser blocking devices

bill.title: Prohibits operation of any motor vehicle equipped with device which affects the operation of traffic-control signals
bill.summary: Prohibits the operation of any motor vehicle equipped with a device which affects the operation of traffic-control signals; provides that the possession of such a device shall constitute a traffic infraction, use thereof is a class A misdemeanor, and use which results in personal injury or death shall constitute a class E felony.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to prohibiting the use of any device which affects the operation of a traffic-control signal

bill.title: Relates to theft of credit card and debit card account numbers
bill.summary: Relates to theft of credit card and debit card account numbers.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to theft of credit card account numbers and debit card account numbers

bill.title: Relates to expanding the offenses to which a child witness may testify by use of closed-circuit television to include murder
bill.summary: Relates to expanding the offenses to which a child witness may testify by use of closed-circuit television to include murder.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law, in relation to expanding the offenses concerning which a child witness may testify by use of closed-circuit television to include murder therein

bill.title: Relates to creating a hazard
bill.summary: Provides that any person who shall abandon in a public place, any controlled substance or dangerous drug as defined in article 220 or 221 of the penal law, shall be guilty of creating a hazard.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to creating a hazard

bill.title: Creates crimes of cemetery desecration of a veteran
bill.summary: Creates crimes of cemetery desecration of a veteran as a class E felony; makes corresponding changes in cemetery desecration crimes in the first and second degrees and aggravated cemetery desecration in the first degree; makes additional penal provisions.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to cemetery desecration and cemetery desecration of a veteran

bill.title: Provides that no person convicted of certain felonies may not file for change of name while incarcerated or under supervised release therefor
bill.summary: Provides that no person convicted of certain felonies defined under specified laws of this state may file a petition for change of name while such person is incarcerated or under supervised release therefor.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the civil rights law, in relation to prohibiting certain felons from changing their names

bill.title: Relates to the offense of sexual abuse in the first degree
bill.summary: Provides that sexual contact upon a person under the age of 13 by a person 21 years of age or older shall be sexual abuse in the first degree.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to sexual abuse of a person under the age of thirteen

bill.title: Relates to authorizing child witnesses to testify by use of closed-circuit television in assault and endangering the welfare of a child proceedings
bill.summary: Relates to authorizing child witnesses to testify by use of closed-circuit television in assault and endangering the welfare of a child proceedings.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law, in relation to authorizing child witnesses to testify by use of closed-circuit television in assault and endangering the welfare of a child proceedings

bill.title: Requires the New York state energy research and development authority to submit an annual report detailing energy efficiency portfolio standard and approving program
bill.summary: Requires the New York state energy research and development authority to submit an annual report detailing energy efficiency portfolio standard and approving programs.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the public authorities law, in relation to requiring the New York state energy research and development authority to establish the energy efficiency portfolio standard and approving programs

bill.title: Relates to the definition of alternate energy production facilities
bill.summary: Adds lithium ion energy batteries to the definition of alternate energy production facilities.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the public service law, in relation to the definition of alternate energy production facilities

bill.title: Provides that the ballots of deceased military personnel shall be counted toward the election for which they were cast
bill.summary: Provides that the ballots of deceased military personnel shall be counted toward the election for which they were cast.
pastCommittees: VETERANS, HOMELAND SECURITY AND MILITARY AFFAIRS
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the military law and the election law, in relation to the counting of ballots of deceased military personnel

bill.title: Amends the NY government reorganization and citizen empowerment act
bill.summary: Amends the NY government reorganization and citizen empowerment act, relating to the requirements for consolidation or dissolution of certain local government entities.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the general municipal law and the municipal home rule law, in relation to the requirements for consolidating or dissolving certain local government entities

sections.name: BILLS ON ORDER OF SECOND REPORT

bill.title: Relates to matching funds for grants under the naturally occurring retirement community supportive service program
bill.summary: Permits support from contiguous areas to provide required matching funds for grants under the naturally occurring retirement community supportive service program.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the elder law, in relation to matching funds for grants under the naturally occurring retirement community supportive service program

bill.title: Relating to assessment exemptions for living quarters for a parent or grandparent
bill.summary: Relates to assessment exemptions for living quarters for a parent or grandparent.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to assessment exemptions for living quarters for a parent or grandparent

bill.title: Permits two or more contiguous towns to jointly purchase highway equipment
bill.summary: Permits two or more contiguous towns to jointly purchase highway equipment.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the highway law, in relation to permitting two or more towns to jointly purchase highway equipment

bill.title: Authorizes county highway superintendents to rent road machinery from any city, town or village
bill.summary: Authorizes county highway superintendents to rent road machinery from any city, town or village.
bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the highway law, in relation to authorizing county highway superintendents to rent road machinery from any city, town or village, and the authority of the town highway superintendent to contract with another municipality, district corporation, school district, community college or any unit of the state university to provide certain services and the use of town machinery, tools and equipment
